N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.9 - Buses-nonscheduled service

State Regulations
(a) General
system. A nonscheduled bus operating under access permit with the NFTA has the
privilege of staging, loading and unloading passengers and luggage in areas so
designated by the airport manager. Such vehicles may load/unload only
passengers whose transportation by such vehicle has been arranged prior to such
vehicle's entry onto airport property. (b) Rules applicable to nonscheduled bus
service. (1)

Vehicle appearance and running
condition. All nonscheduled buses shall be kept clean and in first class
running condition. (2)

Cruising. Cruising buses on airport property is prohibited. (3)

Unauthorized parking. Drivers of
nonscheduled buses shall not park in areas other than those designated by the
airport manager. (4)

Solicitation. Nonscheduled bus operators, or any driver or employee of such operators, shall
not engage in solicitation at the airport or in any way collaborate with or
encourage any other person to solicit business at the airport on such
operator's behalf. (5)

Improper
conduct. Nonscheduled bus operators, drivers, and employees shall not engage in
improper conduct, including, but not limited to, boisterous conversations, profanity or fighting at the airport, nor shall they provide misleading
information concerning their own or any other ground transportation service at
the airport, or any other service at the airport. (6)

Vehicle requirements. All nonscheduled
buses and their drivers shall at all times meet all applicable requirements
imposed by the New York State Departments of Transportation and Motor Vehicles, in addition to all other applicable State, city and other local
ordinances. (7)

Nonconcessionaire
commercial vehicle identification. Each nonscheduled bus shall be identified by
the name of the business that owns or operates. (c) Fees and charges. As set forth in the
airport tariff as approved by the NFTA Board of
